profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born near Winchester, Va., December 25, 1786; studied under private teachers, and was graduated from Princeton College in 1806; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced; served in the War of 1812; member of the State house of delegates 1812-1814, 1816-1817, 1823-1828, and 1833-1835; high sheriff of Berkeley County 1844 and 1845; elected as a Federalist to the Fifteenth Congress (March 4, 1817-March 3, 1819); died at ``Honeywood,'' Berkeley County, Va. (now West Virginia), April 23, 1852; interment in the family burying ground on his estate, ``Honeywood,'' near Hedgesville, Berkeley County, W.Va.

researchRecord.name: In the Robinson Family Papers, 1725-1848, 610 items.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Edward Colston. An item level inventory is available in the library.
